pullrequest.title: [gz11] Add missing component to error message

content.raw:
humm the parenthesis looks bad if there's more than one component:

~~~
-- BUILD ERRORS: These must be resolved before compiling.
--      Missing: ignition-physics1 (sdf
--      dartsim
--      dartsim-plugin)
-- END BUILD ERRORS
~~~

I tried the following to put all components in a single string:

~~~
diff -r cadabe23cd55 cmake/IgnUtils.cmake
--- a/cmake/IgnUtils.cmake      Tue Oct 02 15:39:32 2018 -0700
+++ b/cmake/IgnUtils.cmake      Tue Oct 02 16:31:18 2018 -0700
@@ -200,7 +200,8 @@
     set(${PACKAGE_NAME}_msg "Missing: ${${PACKAGE_NAME}_pretty}")
 
     if(ign_find_package_COMPONENTS)
-      set(${PACKAGE_NAME}_msg "${${PACKAGE_NAME}_msg} (${ign_find_package_COMPONENTS})")
+      ign_list_to_string(comp_str ${ign_find_package_COMPONENTS})
+      set(${PACKAGE_NAME}_msg "${${PACKAGE_NAME}_msg} (${comp_str})")
     endif()
 
     if(DEFINED ign_find_package_PURPOSE)
~~~

But the result was the following:

~~~
-- BUILD ERRORS: These must be resolved before compiling.
--      Missing: ignition-physics1 ( sdf)
-- END BUILD ERRORS
~~~

If someone knows a nice way of handling this, please let me know. Otherwise I can revisit later.
content.html:
humm the parenthesis looks bad if there's more than one component:

-- BUILD ERRORS: These must be resolved before compiling.
--      Missing: ignition-physics1 (sdf
--      dartsim
--      dartsim-plugin)
-- END BUILD ERRORS

I tried the following to put all components in a single string:

diff -r cadabe23cd55 cmake/IgnUtils.cmake
--- a/cmake/IgnUtils.cmake      Tue Oct 02 15:39:32 2018 -0700
+++ b/cmake/IgnUtils.cmake      Tue Oct 02 16:31:18 2018 -0700
@@ -200,7 +200,8 @@
     set(${PACKAGE_NAME}_msg "Missing: ${${PACKAGE_NAME}_pretty}")

     if(ign_find_package_COMPONENTS)
-      set(${PACKAGE_NAME}_msg "${${PACKAGE_NAME}_msg} (${ign_find_package_COMPONENTS})")
+      ign_list_to_string(comp_str ${ign_find_package_COMPONENTS})
+      set(${PACKAGE_NAME}_msg "${${PACKAGE_NAME}_msg} (${comp_str})")
     endif()

     if(DEFINED ign_find_package_PURPOSE)

But the result was the following:

-- BUILD ERRORS: These must be resolved before compiling.
--      Missing: ignition-physics1 ( sdf)
-- END BUILD ERRORS

If someone knows a nice way of handling this, please let me know. Otherwise I can revisit later.

pullrequest.title: [gz11] Add missing component to error message

content.raw: I’ve made some tweaks on [this branch](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/branch/gz11_missing_component-string_append?dest=gz11#diff) which should make the output a bit cleaner. It also improves `ign_list_to_string` so that it has all the features of `ign_string_append`.
content.html: I’ve made some tweaks on this branch which should make the output a bit cleaner. It also improves ign_list_to_string so that it has all the features of ign_string_append.

pullrequest.title: [gz11] Add missing component to error message

content.raw:
Thanks, works perfectly. Merged into this PR. I didn't see `ign_list_to_string` used anywhere, so I wasn't sure whether it would be ok to add a delimiter... I'm ok with this change if you are.

This is the new output:

~~~
-- BUILD ERRORS: These must be resolved before compiling.
--      Missing: ignition-physics1 (Components: sdf, dartsim, dartsim-plugin)
-- END BUILD ERRORS
~~~
content.html:
Thanks, works perfectly. Merged into this PR. I didn't see ign_list_to_string used anywhere, so I wasn't sure whether it would be ok to add a delimiter... I'm ok with this change if you are.

This is the new output:

-- BUILD ERRORS: These must be resolved before compiling.
--      Missing: ignition-physics1 (Components: sdf, dartsim, dartsim-plugin)
-- END BUILD ERRORS

pullrequest.title: [gz11] Add missing component to error message

content.raw: Yeah, `ign_list_to_string` was carried over from a Gazebo CMakeLists.txt, but I don’t believe anyone has used it until now, so we should be free to make changes to it.
content.html: Yeah, ign_list_to_string was carried over from a Gazebo CMakeLists.txt, but I don’t believe anyone has used it until now, so we should be free to make changes to it.
